lead_paragraph: The complaint filed by the Pennsylvania attorney general was the first time members of a Catholic religious order had been charged with abetting an abuser.

headline.print_headline: Three Ex-Leaders of Catholic Order Are Charged With Aiding Sexual Predator
headline.main: Pennsylvania Charges Ex-Leaders of Catholic Order With Aiding Sexual Predator

snippet: The complaint filed by the Pennsylvania attorney general was the first time members of a Catholic religious order had been charged with abetting an abuser.
abstract: Giles A Schinelli, Robert J D'Aversa and Anthony M Criscitelli, three former leaders of Franciscan religious order in Pennsylvania, are charged with felonies for allowing Friar Stephen Baker, who was known sexual predator, to repeatedly work with children.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Survivors Network of Those Abused by Priests
